content: Follow @TIMEHealthWatching television or playing video games close to bedtime can act like a jolt of caffeine to young children, making them more likely to experience difficulty falling asleep, nightmares, and daytime fatigue, a new study in the journal Pediatrics suggests.
title: TV, Video Games at Night May Cause Sleep Problems in Kids | TIME.com

content: Bright Monitors and Video Games May Alter Biological ClockJune 19, 2003 - Playing a video game or finishing up some work on computer before bed may keep you awake long after you turn the computer off. A new study shows that the bright light of a computer screen may alter the body's biological clock and suppress the natural production of melatonin that's critical to the normal sleep-wake cycle.
title: Nighttime Computer Users May Lose Sleep

content: A goodly number of us enjoy a little bit of video gaming in our lives.  Hopefully the majority of us do it in moderation and go out and enjoy the world around us, but it seems that a few people take it just a tad bit further than most.
title: When Do Extreme Gamers Work Or Sleep?

title: Evening TV, Video Games May Cause Sleep Problems in Kids - News - Health.com

content: Your body needs lots of sleep every night. Here are some ways sleep keeps you healthy.  Sleep helps your body grow strong. Sleep gives you energy to play and have fun. Sleep helps you feel happy.  Sometimes you can't fall asleep when it's time for bed. What can you do to get sleepy? When you rest your body, your brain rests, too. Then you are ready to sleep. How can you tell your body it is time to rest? You can learn how to relax your muscles. Relaxing your muscles can help you feel sleepy. Play the "I Can't Fall Asleep" game to relax your body when you are ready for bed.
